   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_REG:         include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_MON:         include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL:       include
   29: %%         ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE:  include
   30: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS:     include
   31: %%
   32: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   33: %%
   34: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   38: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   39: %%
   40: %% Run a specific group:
   41: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   42: %%
   43: %% Run a specific test case:
   44: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   45: %%
   46: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   47: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   48: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   50: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   51: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   54: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   55: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   59: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   60: %%
   61: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   62: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   63: 
   64: 
   65: 
   66: -module(socket_SUITE).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   69: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   70: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   71: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   72: 
   73: %% Suite exports
   74: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   75: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   76:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   77:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   78:

  183: 
  184: suite() ->
  185:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  186:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  187: 
  188: all() -> 
  189:     Groups = [{reg,          "ESOCK_TEST_REG",        include},
  190:               {monitor,      "ESOCK_TEST_MON",        include},
  191:               {ioctl,        "ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL",      include},
  192: 	      {socket_close, "ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE", include},
  193: 	      {tickets,      "ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS",    include}],
  194:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  195: 
  196: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  197:     [];
  198: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  199:     [{group, Group}];
  200: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  201: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  202: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  203: 		[{group, Group}];
  204: 	    false ->
  205: 		[];
  206: 	    Val ->
  207: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  208: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  209: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  210: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  211: 			[{group, Group}];
  212: 		    _ ->
  213: 			[]
  214: 		end
  215: 	end.
  216:     
  217: 
  218: groups() -> 
  219:     [{reg,                         [], reg_simple_cases()},
  220: 
  221:      {monitor,                     [], monitor_cases()},
  222: 
  223:      {socket_close,                [], socket_close_cases()},
  224:      {sc_ctrl_proc_exit,           [], sc_cp_exit_cases()},
  225:      {sc_local_close,              [], sc_lc_cases()},
  226:      {sc_remote_close,             [], sc_rc_cases()},
  227:      {sc_remote_shutdown,          [], sc_rs_cases()},
  228: 
  229:      {ioctl,                       [], ioctl_cases()},
  230:      {ioctl_simple,                [], ioctl_simple_cases()},
  231:      {ioctl_get,                   [], ioctl_get_cases()},
  232:      {ioctl_set,                   [], ioctl_set_cases()},
  233: 
  234:      %% Ticket groups
  235:      {tickets,                     [], tickets_cases()},
  236:      {otp16359,                    [], otp16359_cases()},
  237:      {otp18240,                    [], otp18240_cases()}
  238:     ].
  239:

  400: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  401:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  402:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  403:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  404:     
  405:     try socket:info() of
  406:         #{} ->
  407:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  408:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  409:                     SKIP;
  410: 
  411:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  412: 
  413:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  414:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  415: 
  416:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  417:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  418: 
  419:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  420:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  421:                         default ->
  422:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  423:                                 ok ->
  424:                                     Config1;
  425:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  426:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  427:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  428:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  429:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  430:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  431:                             end;
  432:                         Quiet ->
  433:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  434:                                 ok ->
  435:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  436:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  437:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  438:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  439:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  440:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  441:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  442:                             end
  443:                     end
  444:             end
  445:     catch
  446:         error : notsup ->
  447:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  448:         error : undef ->
  449:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  450:     end.
  451: 
  452: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  453: 
  454:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  455:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  456:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  457: 
  458:     %% Stop the local monitor
  459:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  460: 
  461:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  462: 
  463:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  464: 
  465:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  466:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  467: 
  468:     Config1.
  469: 
  470: 
  471: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  472:   when (GroupName =:= sc_remote_close) orelse
  473:        (GroupName =:= sc_remote_shutdown) ->
  474:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  475:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  476:               "~n", [GroupName, Config]),
  477:     %% Maybe we should skip the entire suite for this platform,
  478:     %% but for now we just skip these groups, which seem to 
  479:     %% have problems (node start).
  480:     %% As stated elsewhere, its not really Fedora 16, but 
  481:     %% the *really* slow VM that is the issue.
  482:     try is_old_fedora16() of
  483:         ok ->
  484:             Config
  485:     catch
  486:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  487:             SKIP
  488:     end;
  489: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  490:   when (GroupName =:= ioctl) ->
  491:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  492:               "~n   Config:"
  493:               "~n      ~p"
  494:               "~nwhen"
  495:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Requests: "
  496:               "~n~s"
  497:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Flags: "
  498:               "~n~s"
  499:               "~n", [GroupName, Config,
  500:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_requests), 6),
  501:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_flags), 6)]),
  502:     Config;
  503: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  504:     Config.
  505: 
  506: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  507:     Config.
  508: 
  509: format_ioctls(Reqs, PrefixSz) ->
  510:     Max = format_ioctls_max(Reqs),
  511:     format_ioctls(Reqs, string:pad("", PrefixSz), Max).
  512: 
  513: format_ioctls_max(Reqs) ->
  514:     format_ioctls_max(Reqs, 0).
  515: 
  516: format_ioctls_max([], Max) ->
  517:     Max;
  518: format_ioctls_max([{Req, _}|Reqs], Max) when is_atom(Req) ->
  519:     ReqStr = atom_to_list(Req),
  520:     case length(ReqStr)+1 of
  521:         NewMax when (NewMax > Max) ->
  522:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, NewMax);
  523:         _ ->
  524:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, Max)
  525:     end.
  526: 
  527: format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max) ->
  528:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max, []).
  529: 
  530: format_ioctls([], _Prefix, _Max, Acc) ->
  531:     lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Acc));
  532: format_ioctls([{Key, Sup}|IOCtls], Prefix, Max, Acc) ->
  533:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max,
  534:                   [format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) | Acc]).
  535: 
  536: format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) ->
  537:     KeyStr  = io_lib:format("~w:", [Key]),
  538:     KeyStr2 = lists:flatten(string:pad(KeyStr, Max, trailing, " ")),
  539:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s~s ~w~n", [Prefix, KeyStr2, Sup])).
  540: 
  541: 
  542: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  543:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  544:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  545:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  546:     Config.
  547: 
  548: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  549:     Config.
  550: 
  551: 
  552: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  553:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  554:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  555:             Quiet;
  556:         false ->
  557:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  558:                 "true"  -> true;
  559:                 "false" -> false;
  560:                 _       -> default
  561:             end
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564:

  568: %%                             REGISTRY                                %%
  569: %%                                                                     %%
  570: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  571: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  572: 
  573: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  574: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  575: %% has the correct info.
  576: 
  577: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  578:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  579:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
  580:            fun() ->
  581:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
  582:            end).
  583: 
  584: 
  585: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  586:     socket:use_registry(true),
  587: 
  588:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
  589: 
  590:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
  591:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
  592:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
  593:     N = length(Existing),
  594:     SupportsIPV6 =
  595:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
  596:             ok ->
  597:                 true;
  598:             _ ->
  599:                 false
  600:         end,
  601:     SupportsLOCAL =
  602:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
  603:             ok ->
  604:                 true;
  605:             _ ->
  606:                 false
  607:         end,
  608:     SupportsSCTP =
  609:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
  610:             ok ->
  611:                 true;
  612:             _ ->
  613:                 false
  614:         end,
  615:     InitSockInfos =
  616:         [
  617:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  618:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  619:         ] ++
  620:         case SupportsIPV6 of
  621:             true ->
  622:                 [
  623:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
  624:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
  625:                 ];
  626:             false ->
  627:                 []
  628:         end ++
  629:         case SupportsLOCAL of
  630:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
  631:                 [
  632:                  {local, stream, default},
  633:                  {local, dgram,  default}
  634:                 ];
  635:             true ->
  636:                 [
  637:                  {local, stream, default}
  638:                 ];
  639:             false ->
  640:                 []
  641:         end ++
  642:         [
  643:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  644:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  645:         ] ++
  646:         case SupportsSCTP of
  647:             true ->
  648:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  649:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  650:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  651:                 case socket:open(inet,
  652:                                  seqpacket,
  653:                                  sctp,
  654:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  655:                     {ok, S} ->
  656:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  657:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
  658:                         [
  659:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
  660:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
  661:                         ];
  662:                     {error, _} ->
  663:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  664:                         []
  665:                 end;
  666:             false ->
  667:                 []
  668:         end ++
  669:         [
  670:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  671:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  672:         ] ++
  673:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
  674:             true ->
  675:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  676:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  677:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  678:                 case socket:open(inet6,
  679:                                  seqpacket,
  680:                                  sctp,
  681:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  682:                     {ok, S6} ->
  683:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  684:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
  685:                         [
  686:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
  687:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
  688:                         ];
  689:                     {error, _} ->
  690:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  691:                         []
  692:                 end;
  693:             false ->
  694:                 []
  695:         end,
  696: 
  697:     i("open sockets"),
  698:     Socks =
  699:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
  700:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
  701:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
  702:                  Sock
  703:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
  704: 
  705:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  706: 
  707: 
  708:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
  709: 
  710:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
  711:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
  712: 
  713:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
  714:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
  715:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
  716:         true ->
  717:             ok;
  718:         false ->
  719:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
  720:     end,
  721: 
  722: 
  723:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
  724: 
  725:     %% inet, stream, tcp
  726:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
  727:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
  728: 
  729:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
  730:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
  731:         true ->
  732:             ok;
  733:         false ->
  734:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
  735:     end,
  736: 
  737: 
  738:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
  739: 
  740:     %% inet, dgram, udp
  741:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
  742:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
  743: 
  744:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
  745:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
  746:         true ->
  747:             ok;
  748:         false ->
  749:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
  750:     end,
  751: 
  752: 
  753:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
  754: 
  755:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
  756:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  757:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  758: 
  759:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
  760:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
  761:         true ->
  762:             ok;
  763:         false ->
  764:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
  765:     end,
  766: 
  767: 
  768:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
  769: 
  770:     %% inet
  771:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
  772:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
  773: 
  774:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
  775:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
  776:         true ->
  777:             ok;
  778:         false ->
  779:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
  780:     end,
  781: 
  782: 
  783:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
  784: 
  785:     %% inet6
  786:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
  787:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
  788: 
  789:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
  790:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
  791:         true ->
  792:             ok;
  793:         false ->
  794:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
  795:     end,
  796: 
  797: 
  798:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
  799: 
  800:     %% local
  801:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
  802:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
  803: 
  804:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
  805:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
  806:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
  807:         true ->
  808:             ok;
  809:         false ->
  810:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
  811:     end,
  812: 
  813: 
  814:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
  815: 
  816:     i("close sockets"),
  817:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  818:                           i("close socket"),                          
  819:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  820:                   end, Socks),
  821: 
  822:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  823: 
  824:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  825: 
  826:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
  827:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
  828:         true ->
  829:             ok;
  830:         false ->
  831:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
  832:     end,
  833: 
  834: 
  835:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
  836:     Expected1 = [],
  837:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
  838:         Expected1 ->
  839:             ok;
  840:         Unexpected1 ->
  841:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
  842:     end,
  843: 
  844:     i("create some sockets", []),
  845:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
  846:                    [fun({D, T})->
  847:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
  848:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
  849:                             OSocks
  850:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
  851:                                          [{inet, dgram},
  852:                                           {inet, dgram},
  853:                                           {inet, stream},
  854:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
  855: 
  856:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
  857:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
  858:         OwnSockets ->
  859:             ok;
  860:         Unexpected2 ->
  861:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
  862:     end,
  863: 
  864:     i("close (own) sockets"),
  865:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  866:                           i("close socket"),                          
  867:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  868:                   end, OwnSockets),
  869:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  870: 
  871:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
  872:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  873: 
  874:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
  875:     case socket:which_sockets() of
  876:         Existing ->
  877:             ok;
  878:         OtherSockets ->
  879:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
  880:     end,
  881: 
  882:     socket:use_registry(false),
  883:     ok.
  884: 
  885: 
  886: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
  887:     socket:use_registry(false),
  888:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
  889: 
  890: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
  891:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
  892:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  893: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
  894:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  895:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
  896: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
  897:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  898:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
  899: 
  900: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  901:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
  902:            (_) -> false
  903:         end,
  904:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  905: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
  906:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
  907:            (_) -> false
  908:         end,
  909:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  910: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
  911:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
  912:            (_) -> false
  913:         end,
  914:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  915: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  916:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  917:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
  918:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
  919:                 true;
  920:            (_) ->
  921:                 false
  922:         end,
  923:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
  924: 
  925: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
  926:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
  927: 
  928: 
  929: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  930:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
  931:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
  932: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  933:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
  934:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  935: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
  936:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  937:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
  938: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
  939:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  940:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
  941: 
  942: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  943:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
  944:                 true;
  945:            (_X) ->
  946:                 false
  947:         end,
  948:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
  949: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  950:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
  951:               type     := T,
  952:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  953:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
  954:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
  955:                 true;
  956:            (_X) ->
  957:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
  958:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
  959:                 false
  960:         end,
  961:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
  962: 
  963: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
  964:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
  965: 
  966: 
  967: 
  968: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  969: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  970: %% has the correct info.
  971: 
  972: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  973:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  974:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
  975:            fun() ->
  976:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
  977:            end).
  978: 
  979: 
  980: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  981:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
  982:     socket:use_registry(true),
  983:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
  984: 
  985:     i("get current socket base count"),
  986:     Base = socket:number_of(),
  987: 
  988:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
  989:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  990:     Base1 = Base + 1,
  991:     case socket:number_of() of
  992:         Base1 ->
  993:             ok;
  994:         Invalid1 -> 
  995:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
  996:     end,
  997:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
  998:     ok = socket:close(S1),
  999:     case socket:number_of() of
 1000:         Base ->
 1001:             ok;
 1002:         Invalid2 -> 
 1003:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
 1004:     end,
 1005: 
 1006:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
 1007:       "and ensure its not counted"),
 1008:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
 1009:     case socket:number_of() of
 1010:         Base ->
 1011:             ok;
 1012:         Invalid3 -> 
 1013:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
 1014:     end,
 1015:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1016:     ok = socket:close(S2),
 1017:     case socket:number_of() of
 1018:         Base ->
 1019:             ok;
 1020:         Invalid4 -> 
 1021:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
 1022:     end,
 1023: 
 1024:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
 1025:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1026:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
 1027:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1028:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
 1029:     case socket:number_of() of
 1030:         Base ->
 1031:             ok;
 1032:         Invalid5 -> 
 1033:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
 1034:     end,
 1035:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1036:     ok = socket:close(S3),
 1037:     case socket:number_of() of
 1038:         Base ->
 1039:             ok;
 1040:         Invalid6 -> 
 1041:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
 1042:     end,
 1043: 
 1044:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
 1045:       "and ensure its counted"),
 1046:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
 1047:     case socket:number_of() of
 1048:         Base1 ->
 1049:             ok;
 1050:         Invalid7 -> 
 1051:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
 1052:     end,
 1053:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
 1054:     ok = socket:close(S4),
 1055:     case socket:number_of() of
 1056:         Base ->
 1057:             ok;
 1058:         Invalid8 -> 
 1059:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
 1060:     end,
 1061: 
 1062:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1063:     i("done"),
 1064:     ok.
 1065: 
 1066: 
 1067: 
 1068: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1069: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1070: %%                                                                     %%
 1071: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
 1072: %%                                                                     %%
 1073: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1074: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1075: 
 1076: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1077: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
 1078: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1079: 
 1080: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1081:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1082:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
 1083:            fun() ->
 1084: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1085:                                  type     => stream,
 1086:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1087:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
 1088:            end).
 1089: 
 1090: 
 1091: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
 1092:     OwnerSeq =
 1093:         [
 1094:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1095:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1096:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1097:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1098:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1099:                    end},
 1100:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1101:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1102:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1103:                            ok
 1104:                    end},
 1105: 
 1106:          %% *** Init part ***
 1107:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1108:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1109:                          type     := Type, 
 1110:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1111:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1112:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1113:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1114:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1115:                                    ERROR
 1116:                            end
 1117:                    end},
 1118:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1119:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1120:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1121:                            ok
 1122:                    end},
 1123: 
 1124:          %% The actual test
 1125:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1126:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1127:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1128:                    end},
 1129: 
 1130:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1131:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1132:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1133: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1134:                    end},
 1135: 
 1136:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1137:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1138:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1139:                                ok ->
 1140:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1141:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1142:                                    ERROR
 1143:                            end
 1144:                    end},
 1145: 
 1146:          %% *** We are done ***
 1147:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1148:         ],
 1149: 
 1150:     TesterSeq =
 1151:         [
 1152:          %% *** Init part ***
 1153:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1154:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1155:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1156:                            ok
 1157:                    end},
 1158:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1159:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1160:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1161:                            ok
 1162:                    end},
 1163:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1164:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1165:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1166:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1167:                    end},
 1168:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1169:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1170: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1171: 			   ok
 1172:                    end},
 1173:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1174:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1175: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1176: 			   ok
 1177:                    end},
 1178:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
 1179:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1180:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1181:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1182: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
 1183: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 1184: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
 1185: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
 1186:                    end},
 1187:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 1188:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1189: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1190: 			   ok
 1191:                    end},
 1192:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 1193:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1194: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1195: 			   ok
 1196:                    end},
 1197:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
 1198:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
 1199: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1200: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1201: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
 1202: 			       Mons ->
 1203: 				   ok;
 1204: 			       SMons ->
 1205: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
 1206: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1207: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1208: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1209: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1210: 			   end
 1211:                    end},
 1212:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
 1213:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1214: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
 1215: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1216: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1217: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
 1218: 			       Mons ->
 1219: 				   ok;
 1220: 			       SMons ->
 1221: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
 1222: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1223: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1224: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1225: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1226: 			   end
 1227:                    end},
 1228:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1229:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1230: 			   Self   = self(),
 1231: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1232: 			   ok
 1233:                    end},
 1234: 
 1235:          %% The actual test
 1236:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1237:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1238:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1239:                            ok
 1240:                    end},
 1241:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
 1242:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1243: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
 1244: 			   receive
 1245: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1246: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1247: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1248: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1249: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1250: 					       [MRef,
 1251: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1252: 						Info]),
 1253: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
 1254: 			   after 5000 ->
 1255: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1256: 				   {error, timeout}
 1257: 			   end
 1258:                    end},
 1259:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
 1260:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1261: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 1262: 			   receive
 1263: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1264: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1265: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1266: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1267: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1268: 					       [MRef,
 1269: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1270: 						Info]),
 1271: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
 1272: 			   after 5000 ->
 1273: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1274: 				   {error, timeout}
 1275: 			   end
 1276:                    end},
 1277:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1278:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1279: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1280: 			   ok
 1281:                    end},
 1282:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1283:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1284: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1285: 			   ok
 1286:                    end},
 1287:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1288:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1289: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1290: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1291: 			   ok
 1292:                    end},
 1293:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1294:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1295: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1296: 			   ok
 1297:                    end},
 1298: 
 1299:          %% Cleanup
 1300:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1301:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1302:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1303:                            ok
 1304:                    end},
 1305: 
 1306:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1307:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1308:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1309:                                ok ->
 1310:                                    ok;
 1311:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1312:                                    ERROR
 1313:                            end
 1314:                    end},
 1315: 
 1316:          %% *** We are done ***
 1317:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1318:         ],
 1319: 
 1320:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1321:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1322: 
 1323:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1324:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1325:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1326: 
 1327:     i("await evaluator"),
 1328:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1329: 
 1330: 
 1331: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1332: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
 1333: %% owner process.
 1334: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1335: 
 1336: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1337:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1338:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
 1339:            fun() ->
 1340: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1341:                                  type     => stream,
 1342:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1343:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
 1344:            end).
 1345: 
 1346: 
 1347: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
 1348:     OwnerSeq =
 1349:         [
 1350:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1351:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1352:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1353:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1354:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1355:                    end},
 1356:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1357:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1358:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1359:                            ok
 1360:                    end},
 1361: 
 1362:          %% *** Init part ***
 1363:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1364:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1365:                          type     := Type, 
 1366:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1367:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1368:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1369:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1370:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1371:                                    ERROR
 1372:                            end
 1373:                    end},
 1374:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1375:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1376:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1377:                            ok
 1378:                    end},
 1379: 
 1380:          %% The actual test
 1381:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1382:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1383:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1384:                                ok ->
 1385:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1386:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1387:                                    ERROR
 1388:                            end
 1389:                    end},
 1390: 
 1391:          %% *** We are done ***
 1392:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1393:         ],
 1394: 
 1395:     TesterSeq =
 1396:         [
 1397:          %% *** Init part ***
 1398:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1399:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1400:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1401:                            ok
 1402:                    end},
 1403:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1404:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1405:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1406:                            ok
 1407:                    end},
 1408:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1409:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1410:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1411:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1412:                    end},
 1413:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1414:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1415: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1416: 			   ok
 1417:                    end},
 1418:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1419:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1420: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1421: 			   ok
 1422:                    end},
 1423:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1424:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1425:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1426: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1427: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1428:                    end},
 1429:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1430:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1431: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1432: 			   ok
 1433:                    end},
 1434:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1435:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1436: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1437: 			   ok
 1438:                    end},
 1439:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1440:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1441: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1442: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1443: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1444: 			   ok
 1445:                    end},
 1446:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1447:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1448: 			   Self   = self(),
 1449: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1450: 			   ok
 1451:                    end},
 1452: 
 1453:          %% The actual test
 1454:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1455:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1456:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1457:                            ok
 1458:                    end},
 1459:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1460:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1461:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1462:                                ok ->
 1463:                                    ok;
 1464:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1465:                                    ERROR
 1466:                            end
 1467:                    end},
 1468: 
 1469:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1470:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1471: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1472: 			   receive
 1473: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1474: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1475: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1476: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1477: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1478: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1479: 				   ok
 1480: 			   after 5000 ->
 1481: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1482: 				   {error, timeout}
 1483: 			   end
 1484:                    end},
 1485:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1486:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1487: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1488: 			   ok
 1489:                    end},
 1490:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1491:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1492: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1493: 			   ok
 1494:                    end},
 1495:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1496:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1497: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1498: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1499: 			   ok
 1500:                    end},
 1501:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1502:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1503: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1504: 			   ok
 1505:                    end},
 1506: 
 1507:          %% *** We are done ***
 1508:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1509:         ],
 1510: 
 1511:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1512:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1513: 
 1514:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1515:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1516:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1517: 
 1518:     i("await evaluator"),
 1519:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1520:

 1522: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1523: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
 1524: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
 1525: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
 1526: 
 1527: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1528:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1529:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
 1530:            fun() ->
 1531: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1532:                                  type     => stream,
 1533:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1534:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
 1535:            end).
 1536: 
 1537: 
 1538: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
 1539:     OwnerSeq =
 1540:         [
 1541:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1542:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1543:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1544:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1545:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1546:                    end},
 1547:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1548:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1549:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1550:                            ok
 1551:                    end},
 1552: 
 1553:          %% *** Init part ***
 1554:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1555:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1556:                          type     := Type, 
 1557:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1558:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1559:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1560:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1561:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1562:                                    ERROR
 1563:                            end
 1564:                    end},
 1565:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1566:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1567:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1568:                            ok
 1569:                    end},
 1570: 
 1571:          %% The actual test
 1572:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1573:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1574:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1575:                    end},
 1576: 
 1577:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1578:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1579:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1580: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1581:                    end},
 1582: 
 1583:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1584:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1585:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1586:                                ok ->
 1587:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1588:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1589:                                    ERROR
 1590:                            end
 1591:                    end},
 1592: 
 1593:          %% *** We are done ***
 1594:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1595:         ],
 1596: 
 1597:     TesterSeq =
 1598:         [
 1599:          %% *** Init part ***
 1600:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1601:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1602:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1603:                            ok
 1604:                    end},
 1605:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1606:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1607:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1608:                            ok
 1609:                    end},
 1610:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1611:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1612:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1613:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1614:                    end},
 1615:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1616:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1617: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1618: 			   ok
 1619:                    end},
 1620:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1621:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1622: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1623: 			   ok
 1624:                    end},
 1625:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1626:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1627:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1628: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1629: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1630:                    end},
 1631:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1632:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1633: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1634: 			   ok
 1635:                    end},
 1636:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1637:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1638: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1639: 			   ok
 1640:                    end},
 1641: 
 1642:          %% The actual test
 1643:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
 1644:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
 1645:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 1646: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
 1647:                    end},
 1648: 
 1649: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1650: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1651: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1652: 			   ok
 1653: 		   end},
 1654: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1655: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1656: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1657: 			   ok
 1658: 		   end},
 1659: 
 1660:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1661:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1662:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1663:                            ok
 1664:                    end},
 1665: 
 1666:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1667:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1668: 			   receive
 1669: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1670: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
 1671: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1672: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1673: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1674: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1675: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
 1676: 			   after 5000 ->
 1677: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
 1678: 				   ok
 1679: 			   end
 1680:                    end},
 1681: 
 1682:          %% Cleanup
 1683:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1684:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1685:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1686:                            ok
 1687:                    end},
 1688: 
 1689:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1690:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1691:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1692:                                ok ->
 1693:                                    ok;
 1694:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1695:                                    ERROR
 1696:                            end
 1697:                    end},
 1698: 
 1699:          %% *** We are done ***
 1700:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1701:         ],
 1702: 
 1703:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1704:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1705: 
 1706:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1707:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1708:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1709: 
 1710:     i("await evaluator"),
 1711:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1712:

 1714: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1715: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
 1716: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1717: 
 1718: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1719:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1720:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
 1721:            fun() ->
 1722: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1723:                                  type     => stream,
 1724:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1725:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 1726:            end).
 1727: 
 1728: 
 1729: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 1730:     OwnerSeq =
 1731:         [
 1732:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1733:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1734:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1735:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1736:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1737:                    end},
 1738:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1739:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1740:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),

 2154: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2155: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then exit
 2156: %% the owner process.
 2157: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2158: 
 2159: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2160:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2161:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks,
 2162:            fun() ->
 2163: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2164:                                  type     => stream,
 2165:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2166:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState)
 2167:            end).
 2168: 
 2169: 
 2170: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2171:     OwnerSeq =
 2172:         [
 2173:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2174:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2175:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2176:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2177:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2178:                    end},
 2179:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2180:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2181:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2182:                            ok
 2183:                    end},
 2184: 
 2185:          %% *** Init part ***
 2186:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2187:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2188:                          type     := Type, 
 2189:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2190:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2191:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2192:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2193:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2194:                                    ERROR
 2195:                            end
 2196:                    end},
 2197:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2198:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2199:                          type     := Type, 
 2200:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2201:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2202:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2203:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2204:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2205:                                    ERROR
 2206:                            end
 2207:                    end},
 2208:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2209:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2210:                          type     := Type, 
 2211:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2212:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2213:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2214:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2215:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2216:                                    ERROR
 2217:                            end
 2218:                    end},
 2219:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2220:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2221:                          type     := Type, 
 2222:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2223:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2224:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2225:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2226:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2227:                                    ERROR
 2228:                            end
 2229:                    end},
 2230:          #{desc => "create socket 5",

 2232:                          type     := Type, 
 2233:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2234:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of

 2237:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2238:                                    ERROR
 2239:                            end
 2240:                    end},
 2241:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",

 2243: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2244: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2245: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2246: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2247: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2248: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2249:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2250:                            ok
 2251:                    end},
 2252: 
 2253: 
 2254:          %% The actual test
 2255:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2256:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2257:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2258:                                ok ->
 2259:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2260:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2261:                                    ERROR
 2262:                            end
 2263:                    end},
 2264: 
 2265:          %% *** We are done ***
 2266:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2267:         ],
 2268:

 2270:         [

 2299: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),

 2308:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2309:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2310:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2311:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2312:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2313: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2314: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2315: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2316: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2317: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2318: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2319: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2320: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2321: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2322: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2323: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2324: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2325:                    end},
 2326:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2327:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2328: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2329: 			   ok
 2330:                    end},
 2331:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2332:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2333: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2334: 			   ok
 2335:                    end},
 2336: 
 2337:          %% The actual test
 2338:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2339:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2340:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2341:                            ok
 2342:                    end},
 2343: 
 2344:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 2345:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2346:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2347:                                ok ->
 2348:                                    ok;
 2349:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2350:                                    ERROR
 2351:                            end
 2352:                    end},
 2353: 
 2354:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
 2355:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
 2356: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2357: 			   receive
 2358: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2359: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2360: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2361: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2362: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2363: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2364: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2365: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2366: 				   {ok, State3}
 2367: 			   after 5000 ->
 2368: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2369: 				   {error, timeout}
 2370: 			   end
 2371:                    end},
 2372:          #{desc => "await socket 2 down",
 2373:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock,
 2374: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 2375: 			   receive
 2376: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2377: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2378: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2379: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2380: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2381: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2382: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock2, State),
 2383: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon2,  State2),
 2384: 				   {ok, State3}
 2385: 			   after 5000 ->
 2386: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2387: 				   {error, timeout}
 2388: 			   end
 2389:                    end},
 2390:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2391:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2392: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2393: 			   receive
 2394: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2395: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2396: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2397: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2398: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2399: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2400: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2401: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2402: 				   {ok, State3}
 2403: 			   after 5000 ->
 2404: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2405: 				   {error, timeout}
 2406: 			   end
 2407:                    end},

 2410: 			 mon4  := MRef} = State) ->
 2411: 			   receive
 2412: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2413: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2414: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"

 2416: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2417: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2418: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock4, State),
 2419: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon4,  State2),
 2420: 				   {ok, State3}
 2421: 			   after 5000 ->
 2422: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2423: 				   {error, timeout}
 2424: 			   end

 2430: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2431: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "

 2459:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2460:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2461:

 2463:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2464:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),

 2467:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
