 2470: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2471: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process, demonitor
 2472: %% two of them then close socket.
 2473: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN for
 2474: %% the sockets that are still monitored.
 2475: 
 2476: monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2477:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2478:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks,
 2479:            fun() ->
 2480: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2481:                                  type     => stream,
 2482:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2483:                    ok = mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 2484:            end).
 2485: 
 2486: 
 2487: mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2488:     OwnerSeq =
 2489:         [
 2490:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2491:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2492:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2493:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2494:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2495:                    end},
 2496:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2497:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2498:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2499:                            ok
 2500:                    end},
 2501: 
 2502:          %% *** Init part ***
 2503:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2504:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2505:                          type     := Type, 
 2506:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2507:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2508:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2509:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2510:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2511:                                    ERROR
 2512:                            end
 2513:                    end},
 2514:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2515:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2516:                          type     := Type, 
 2517:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2518:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2519:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2520:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2521:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2522:                                    ERROR
 2523:                            end
 2524:                    end},
 2525:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2526:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2527:                          type     := Type, 
 2528:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2529:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2530:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2531:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2532:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2533:                                    ERROR
 2534:                            end
 2535:                    end},
 2536:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2537:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2538:                          type     := Type, 
 2539:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2540:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2541:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2542:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2543:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2544:                                    ERROR
 2545:                            end
 2546:                    end},
 2547:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2548:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2549:                          type     := Type, 
 2550:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2551:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2552:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2553:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2554:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2555:                                    ERROR
 2556:                            end
 2557:                    end},
 2558:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2559:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2560: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2561: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2562: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2563: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2564: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2565: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2566:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2567:                            ok
 2568:                    end},
 2569: 
 2570:          %% The actual test
 2571:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 2572:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2573:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 2574:                    end},
 2575:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 2576:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 2577:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2578: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 2579:                    end},
 2580: 
 2581:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 2582:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2583:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 2584:                    end},
 2585:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 2586:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 2587:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2588: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 2589:                    end},
 2590: 
 2591:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 2592:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2593:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 2594:                    end},
 2595:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 2596:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 2597:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2598: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 2599:                    end},
 2600: 
 2601:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2602:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2603:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2604:                                ok ->
 2605:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2606:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2607:                                    ERROR
 2608:                            end
 2609:                    end},
 2610: 
 2611:          %% *** We are done ***
 2612:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2613:         ],
 2614: 
 2615:     TesterSeq =
 2616:         [
 2617:          %% *** Init part ***
 2618:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 2619:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 2620:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 2621:                            ok
 2622:                    end},
 2623:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 2624:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2625:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 2626:                            ok
 2627:                    end},
 2628:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 2629:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 2630:                            {ok, [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5]} =
 2631: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 2632:                            {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock1,
 2633: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
 2634: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
 2635: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
 2636: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
 2637:                    end},
 2638:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2639:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2640: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2641: 			   ok
 2642:                    end},
 2643:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2644:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2645: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2646: 			   ok
 2647:                    end},
 2648:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 2649:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock1,
 2650: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
 2651: 			 sock3 := Sock3,
 2652: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
 2653: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
 2654:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2655:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2656:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2657:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2658:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2659: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2660: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2661: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2662: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2663: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2664: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2665: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2666: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2667: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2668: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2669: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2670: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2671:                    end},
 2672:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2673:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2674: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2675: 			   ok
 2676:                    end},
 2677:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2678:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2679: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2680: 			   ok
 2681:                    end},
 2682: 
 2683:          %% The actual test
 2684:          #{desc => "demonitor socket(s)",
 2685:            cmd  => fun(#{mon2 := MRef2,
 2686: 			 mon4 := MRef4} = State) ->
 2687:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef2),
 2688:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef4),
 2689: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("cancel socket monitor 2 and 4"),
 2690: 			   State2 = maps:remove(mon2,  State),
 2691: 			   State3 = maps:remove(sock2, State2),
 2692: 			   State4 = maps:remove(mon4,  State3),
 2693: 			   State5 = maps:remove(sock4, State4),
 2694: 			   {ok, State5}
 2695:                    end},
 2696:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=3)",
 2697:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2698: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2699: 			   ok
 2700:                    end},
 2701:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=3)",
 2702:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2703: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2704: 			   ok
 2705:                    end},
 2706:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
 2707:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2708:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
 2709:                            ok
 2710:                    end},
 2711:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",

 2713: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2714: 			   receive
 2715: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2716: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2717: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2718: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2719: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2720: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2721: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2722: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2723: 				   {ok, State3}
 2724: 			   after 5000 ->
 2725: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2726: 				   {error, timeout}
 2727: 			   end
 2728:                    end},
 2729:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 2730:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2731: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2732: 			   ok
 2733:                    end},
 2734:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",

 2736: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),

 2738:                    end},
 2739: 
 2740:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 3",
 2741:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2742:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close3),
 2743:                            ok
 2744:                    end},
 2745:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2746:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2747: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2748: 			   receive
 2749: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2750: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2751: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2752: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2753: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2754: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2755: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2756: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2757: 				   {ok, State3}
 2758: 			   after 5000 ->
 2759: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2760: 				   {error, timeout}
 2761: 			   end
 2762:                    end},
 2763:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 2764:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2765: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2766: 			   ok
 2767:                    end},
 2768:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 2769:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2770: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2771: 			   ok
 2772:                    end},
 2773: 
 2774:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 5",
 2775:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2776:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close5),
 2777:                            ok
 2778:                    end},
 2779:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2780:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2781: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2782: 			   receive
 2783: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2784: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2785: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2786: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2787: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2788: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2789: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2790: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2791: 				   {ok, State3}
 2792: 			   after 5000 ->
 2793: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2794: 				   {error, timeout}
 2795: 			   end
 2796:                    end},
 2797:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2798:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2799: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2800: 			   ok
 2801:                    end},
 2802:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2803:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2804: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2805: 			   ok
 2806:                    end},
 2807: 
 2808:          %% Cleanup
 2809:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2810:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2811:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2812:                            ok
 2813:                    end},
 2814: 
 2815:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",

 2817:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2818:                                ok ->
 2819:                                    ok;
 2820:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2821:                                    ERROR
 2822:                            end

 2826:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2827:         ],

 2831:

 2834:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2835: 
 2836:     i("await evaluator"),
 2837:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).

 2840: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2841: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 2842: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 2843: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2844: 
 2845: monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2846:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2847:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon,
 2848:            fun() ->
 2849: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2850:                                  type     => stream,
 2851:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2852:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState)
 2853:            end).
 2854: 
 2855: 
 2856: mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 2857:     OwnerSeq =
 2858:         [
 2859:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2860:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2861:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2862:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2863:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2864:                    end},
 2865:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2866:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2867:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2868:                            ok
 2869:                    end},
 2870: 
 2871:          %% *** Init part ***
 2872:          #{desc => "create socket",
 2873:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2874:                          type     := Type, 
 2875:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2876:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2877:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2878:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 2879:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2880:                                    ERROR
 2881:                            end
 2882:                    end},
 2883:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2884:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 2885:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 2886:                            ok
 2887:                    end},
 2888: 
 2889:          %% The actual test
 2890:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 2891:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2892:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 2893:                    end},
 2894: 
 2895:          #{desc => "close socket",
 2896:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 2897:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2898: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 2899:                    end},
 2900: 
 2901: 
 2902:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2903:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2904:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2905:                                ok ->
 2906:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2907:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2908:                                    ERROR
 2909:                            end
 2910:                    end},
 2911: 
 2912:          %% *** We are done ***
 2913:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2914:         ],

 3405:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3406: 
 3407:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 3408:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3409: 
 3410:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3411:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3412: 
 3413:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3414:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3415: 
 3416:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3417:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3418: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3419: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3420: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3421: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3422: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3423:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3424: 
 3425:     i("await evaluator"),
 3426:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3427: 
 3428: 
 3429: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3430: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 3431: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 3432: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 3433: 
 3434: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3435:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 3436:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon,
 3437:            fun() ->
 3438: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 3439:                                  type     => stream,
 3440:                                  protocol => tcp},
 3441:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState)
 3442:            end).
 3443: 
 3444: 
 3445: mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 3446:     OwnerSeq =
 3447:         [
 3448:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3449:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3450:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3451:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3452:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3453:                    end},
 3454:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3455:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3456:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3457:                            ok
 3458:                    end},
 3459: 
 3460:          %% *** Init part ***
 3461:          #{desc => "create socket",
 3462:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 3463:                          type     := Type, 
 3464:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 3465:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 3466:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 3467:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 3468:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3469:                                    ERROR
 3470:                            end
 3471:                    end},
 3472:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3473:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 3474:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 3475:                            ok
 3476:                    end},
 3477: 
 3478:          %% The actual test
 3479:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3480:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3481:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3482:                                ok ->
 3483:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3484:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3485:                                    ERROR
 3486:                            end
 3487:                    end},
 3488: 
 3489:          %% *** We are done ***
 3490:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3491:         ],
 3492: 
 3493: 
 3494:     ClientSeq =
 3495:         [
 3496:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3497:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3498:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3499:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3500:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3501:                    end},
 3502:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3503:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3504:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3505:                            ok
 3506:                    end},
 3507: 
 3508:          %% *** Init part ***
 3509:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3510:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3511:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 3512:                            ok
 3513:                    end},
 3514:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 3515:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3516:                            {ok, Sock} =
 3517: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 3518: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: ~p", [Sock]),
 3519: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 3520:                    end},
 3521: 
 3522: 
 3523:          %% The actual test
 3524:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 3525:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3526:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 3527:                    end},
 3528:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3529:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3530: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3531: 			   ok
 3532:                    end},
 3533:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 3534:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 3535:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 3536: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 3537: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 3538:                    end},
 3539:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 3540:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3541: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3542: 			   ok
 3543:                    end},
 3544: 
 3545:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 3546:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3547:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 3548:                            ok
 3549:                    end},
 3550: 
 3551:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 3552:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3553:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 3554:                    end},
 3555: 
 3556:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 3557:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 3558: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 3559: 			   receive
 3560: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 3561: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 3562: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 3563: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 3564: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 3565: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 3566: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon, State),
 3567: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 3568: 				   {ok, State3}
 3569: 			   after 5000 ->
 3570: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 3571: 				   {error, timeout}
 3572: 			   end
 3573:                    end},
 3574:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3575:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3576: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3577: 			   ok
 3578:                    end},
 3579: 
 3580:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 3581:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3582:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 3583:                            ok
 3584:                    end},
 3585: 
 3586: 
 3587:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3588:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3589:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3590:                                ok ->
 3591:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3592:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3593:                                    ERROR
 3594:                            end
 3595:                    end},
 3596: 
 3597:          %% *** We are done ***
 3598:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3599:         ],

 3952:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 3953: 
 3954:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 3955:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3956: 
 3957:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 3958:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3959: 
 3960:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 3961:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3962: 
 3963:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3964:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3965: 
 3966:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3967:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3968: 
 3969:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3970:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3971: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3972: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3973: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3974: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3975: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3976:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3977: 
 3978:     i("await evaluator"),
 3979:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3980: 
 3981: 
 3982: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3983: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 3984: %% different processes, then close each socket (from 'owner').
 3985: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 3986: %% each socket.
 3987: 
 3988: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3989:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 3990:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 3991:            fun() ->
 3992:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 3993:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 3994:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 3995:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 3996:                        _ ->
 3997:                            ok
 3998:                    end
 3999:            end,
 4000:            fun() ->
 4001: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4002:                                  type     => stream,
 4003:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4004:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4005:            end).
 4006: 
 4007: 
 4008: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4009:     OwnerSeq =
 4010:         [
 4011:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4012:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4013:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4014:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4015:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4016:                    end},
 4017:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4018:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4019:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4020:                            ok
 4021:                    end},
 4022: 
 4023:          %% *** Init part ***
 4024:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4025:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4026:                          type     := Type, 
 4027:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4028:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4029:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4030:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4031:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4032:                                    ERROR
 4033:                            end
 4034:                    end},
 4035:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4036:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4037:                          type     := Type, 
 4038:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4039:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4040:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4041:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 4042:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4043:                                    ERROR
 4044:                            end
 4045:                    end},
 4046:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 4047:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4048:                          type     := Type, 
 4049:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4050:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4051:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4052:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 4053:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4054:                                    ERROR
 4055:                            end
 4056:                    end},
 4057:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 4058:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4059:                          type     := Type, 
 4060:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4061:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4062:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4063:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 4064:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4065:                                    ERROR
 4066:                            end
 4067:                    end},
 4068:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 4069:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4070:                          type     := Type, 
 4071:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4072:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4073:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4074:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 4075:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4076:                                    ERROR
 4077:                            end
 4078:                    end},
 4079:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 4080:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 4081: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 4082: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 4083: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 4084: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 4085: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 4086: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 4087:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 4088:                            ok
 4089:                    end},
 4090: 
 4091:          %% The actual test
 4092:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 4093:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4094:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 4095:                    end},
 4096:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 4097:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 4098:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4099: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 4100:                    end},
 4101: 
 4102:          #{desc => "await continue (close2)",
 4103:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4104:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close2)
 4105:                    end},
 4106:          #{desc => "close socket 2",
 4107:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock} = State) ->
 4108:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4109: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock2, State)}
 4110:                    end},
 4111: 
 4112:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 4113:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4114:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 4115:                    end},
 4116:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 4117:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 4118:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4119: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 4120:                    end},
 4121: 
 4122:          #{desc => "await continue (close4)",
 4123:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4124:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close4)
 4125:                    end},
 4126:          #{desc => "close socket 4",
 4127:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock} = State) ->
 4128:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4129: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock4, State)}
 4130:                    end},
 4131: 
 4132:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 4133:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4134:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 4135:                    end},
 4136:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 4137:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 4138:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4139: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 4140:                    end},
 4141: 
 4142: 
 4143:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 4144:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 4145:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 4146:                                ok ->
 4147:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 4148:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4149:                                    ERROR
 4150:                            end
 4151:                    end},
 4152: 
 4153:          %% *** We are done ***
 4154:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 4155:         ],
 4156:

 4194:                    end},

 4201:                    end},

 4204:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 4205: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),

 4214:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),

 4216:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 4217:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 4218:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 4219: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 4220: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 4221: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 4222: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 4223: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 4224: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 4225: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 4226: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 4227: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 4228: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 4229: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 4230: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 4231:                    end},

 4233:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->

 4242:                    end},

 4265: 			   end

 4914:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 4915:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 4916: 
 4917:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 4918:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4919: 
 4920:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),

 4922: 
 4923:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),

 4925: 
 4926:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),

 4928: 
 4929:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 4930:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4931: 
 4932:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 4933:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 4934: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 4935: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 4936: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 4937: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 4938: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 4939:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 4940: 
 4941:     i("await evaluator"),
 4942:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 4943: 
 4944: 
 4945: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4946: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 4947: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 4948: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 4949: %% each socket.
 4950: 
 4951: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4952:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 4953:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 4954:            fun() ->
 4955:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 4956:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 4957:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 4958:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 4959:                        _ ->
 4960:                            ok
 4961:                    end
 4962:            end,
 4963:            fun() ->
 4964: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4965:                                  type     => stream,
 4966:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4967:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4968:            end).
 4969: 
 4970: 
 4971: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4972:     OwnerSeq =
 4973:         [
 4974:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4975:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4976:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4977:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4978:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4979:                    end},
 4980:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4981:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4982:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4983:                            ok
 4984:                    end},
 4985: 
 4986:          %% *** Init part ***
 4987:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4988:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4989:                          type     := Type, 
 4990:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4991:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4992:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4993:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4994:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4995:                                    ERROR
 4996:                            end
 4997:                    end},
 4998:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4999:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5000:                          type     := Type, 
 5001:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5002:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5003:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5004:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 5005:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5006:                                    ERROR
 5007:                            end
 5008:                    end},
 5009:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 5010:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5011:                          type     := Type, 
 5012:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5013:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5014:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5015:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 5016:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5017:                                    ERROR
 5018:                            end
 5019:                    end},
 5020:          #{desc => "create socket 4",

 5551:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5552:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5553:                                ok ->
 5554:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5555:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5556:                                    ERROR
 5557:                            end
 5558:                    end},
 5559: 
 5560:          #{desc => "await (client 1) ready",
 5561:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5562:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, down)
 5563:                    end},
 5564:          #{desc => "await (client 2) ready",
 5565:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5566:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, down)
 5567:                    end},
 5568:          #{desc => "await (client 3) ready",
 5569:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5570:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, down)
 5571:                    end},
 5572:          #{desc => "await (client 4) ready",
 5573:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5574:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client4, down)
 5575:                    end},
 5576:          #{desc => "await (client 5) ready",
 5577:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5578:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client5, down)
 5579:                    end},
 5580: 
 5581: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5582:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5583: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5584: 			   ok
 5585:                    end},
 5586: 
 5587: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5588: 
 5589:          %% Cleanup
 5590:          #{desc => "order (client 1) terminate",
 5591:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5592:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5593:                            ok
 5594:                    end},
 5595:          #{desc => "await (client 1) termination",
 5596:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 5597:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5598:                                ok ->
 5599:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client1, State)};
 5600:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5601:                                    ERROR
 5602:                            end
 5603:                    end},
 5604: 
 5605:          #{desc => "order (client 2) terminate",
 5606:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5607:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5608:                            ok
 5609:                    end},
 5610:          #{desc => "await (client 2) termination",
 5611:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 5612:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5613:                                ok ->
 5614:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client2, State)};
 5615:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5616:                                    ERROR
 5617:                            end
 5618:                    end},
 5619: 
 5620:          #{desc => "order (client 3) terminate",
 5621:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5622:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5623:                            ok
 5624:                    end},
 5625:          #{desc => "await (client 3) termination",
 5626:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 5627:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5628:                                ok ->
 5629:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client3, State)};
 5630:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5631:                                    ERROR
 5632:                            end
 5633:                    end},
 5634: 
 5635:          #{desc => "order (client 4) terminate",
 5636:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5637:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5638:                            ok
 5639:                    end},
 5640:          #{desc => "await (client 4) termination",
 5641:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = State) ->
 5642:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5643:                                ok ->
 5644:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client4, State)};
 5645:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5646:                                    ERROR
 5647:                            end
 5648:                    end},
 5649: 
 5650:          #{desc => "order (client 5) terminate",
 5651:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5652:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5653:                            ok
 5654:                    end},
 5655:          #{desc => "await (client 5) termination",
 5656:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = State) ->
 5657:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5658:                                ok ->
 5659:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client5, State)};
 5660:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5661:                                    ERROR
 5662:                            end
 5663:                    end},
 5664: 
 5665:          %% *** We are done ***
 5666:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5667:         ],
 5668: 
 5669:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5670:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5671: 
 5672:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 5673:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5674: 
 5675:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 5676:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5677: 
 5678:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 5679:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5680: 
 5681:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 5682:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5683: 
 5684:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 5685:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5686: 
 5687:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5688:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 5689: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 5690: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 5691: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 5692: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 5693: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 5694:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5695: 
 5696:     i("await evaluator"),
 5697:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 5698: 
 5699: 
 5700: 
 5701: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5702: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 5703: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 5704: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 5705: %% each socket.
 5706: 
 5707: monitor_closed_socket(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5708:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 5709:     tc_try(monitor_closed_socket,
 5710:            fun() ->
 5711: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5712:                                  type     => stream,
 5713:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5714:                    ok = mon_closed_socket(InitState)
 5715:            end).
 5716: 
 5717: 
 5718: mon_closed_socket(InitState) ->
 5719:     OwnerSeq =
 5720:         [
 5721:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5722:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5723:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5724:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5725:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5726:                    end},
 5727:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5728:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5729:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5730:                            ok
 5731:                    end},
 5732: 
 5733:          %% *** Init part ***
 5734:          #{desc => "create socket",
 5735:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5736:                          type     := Type, 
 5737:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5738:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5739:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5740:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 5741:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5742:                                    ERROR
 5743:                            end
 5744:                    end},
 5745:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5746:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 5747: 			 sock   := Sock} = State) ->
 5748:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 5749:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 5750:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 5751:                    end},
 5752: 
 5753:          %% The actual test
 5754:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5755:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5756:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5757:                                ok ->
 5758:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5759:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5760:                                    ERROR
 5761:                            end
 5762:                    end},
 5763: 
 5764:          %% *** We are done ***
 5765:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5766:         ],
 5767: 
 5768: 
 5769:     ClientSeq =
 5770:         [
 5771:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5772:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5773:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5774:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5775:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5776:                    end},
 5777:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5778:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5779:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5780:                            ok
 5781:                    end},
 5782: 
 5783:          %% *** Init part ***
 5784:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5785:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5786:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 5787:                            ok
 5788:                    end},
 5789:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 5790:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5791:                            {ok, Sock} =
 5792:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 5793: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: "
 5794: 				       "~n      ~p", [Sock]),
 5795: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5796:                    end},
 5797: 
 5798: 
 5799:          %% The actual test
 5800:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 5801:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5802:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 5803:                    end},
 5804: 
 5805:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 5806:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 5807:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 5808: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 5809: 				       "~n      ~p", [MRef]),
 5810: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 5811:                    end},
 5812:          
 5813:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 5814:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5815:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 5816:                            ok
 5817:                    end},
 5818: 
 5819:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 5820:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5821:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 5822:                    end},
 5823: 
 5824:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 5825:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 5826: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 5827: 			   receive
 5828: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 5829: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 5830: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 5831: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 5832: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 5833: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 5834: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
 5835: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 5836: 				   {ok, State3}
 5837: 			   after 1000 ->
 5838: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 5839: 				   {error, timeout}
 5840: 			   end
 5841:                    end},
 5842: 
 5843:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 5844:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5845:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 5846:                            ok
 5847:                    end},
 5848: 
 5849: 
 5850:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5851:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5852:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5853:                                ok ->
 5854:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5855:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5856:                                    ERROR
 5857:                            end
 5858:                    end},
 5859: 
 5860:          %% *** We are done ***
 5861:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5862:         ],
 5863: 
 5864:     TesterSeq =
 5865:         [
 5866:          %% *** Init part ***
 5867:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
 5868:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 5869:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 5870:                            ok
 5871:                    end},
 5872:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 5873:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5874:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5875:                            ok
 5876:                    end},
 5877:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 5878:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5879:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 5880:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5881:                    end},
 5882: 
 5883:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 5884:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5885:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 5886:                            ok
 5887:                    end},
 5888:          #{desc => "order client start",
 5889:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5890:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5891:                            ok
 5892:                    end},
 5893:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5894:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5895:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 5896:                    end},
 5897:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
 5898:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 5899: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
 5900:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
 5901:                            ok
 5902:                    end},
 5903: 
 5904:          %% The actual test
 5905:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
 5906:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
 5907:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
 5908:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5909:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
 5910:                            ok
 5911:                    end},
 5912:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5913:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5914:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
 5915:                    end},
 5916: 
 5917:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
 5918:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5919:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
 5920:                            ok
 5921:                    end},
 5922: 
 5923: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5924: 
 5925:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 5926:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5927:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5928:                            ok
 5929:                    end},
 5930:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5931:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5932:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5933:                                ok ->
 5934:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5935:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5936:                                    ERROR
 5937:                            end
 5938:                    end},
 5939: 
 5940:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5941:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5942:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
 5943:                    end},
 5944: 
 5945: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5946:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5947: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5948: 			   ok
 5949:                    end},
 5950: 
 5951: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5952: 
 5953:          %% Cleanup
 5954:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 5955:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5956:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5957:                            ok
 5958:                    end},
 5959:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 5960:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 5961:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5962:                                ok ->
 5963:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 5964:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5965:                                    ERROR
 5966:                            end
 5967:                    end},
 5968: 
 5969:          %% *** We are done ***
 5970:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5971:         ],
 5972: 
 5973:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5974:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5975: 
 5976:     i("start client  evaluator"),
 5977:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5978: 
 5979:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5980:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
 5981: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
 5982:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5983: 
 5984:     i("await evaluator"),
 5985:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
 5986:

 5989: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5990: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5991: %%                                                                     %%
 5992: %%                         SOCKET CLOSURE                              %%

 5996: 
 5997: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5998: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 5999: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6000: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
 6001: 
 6002: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6003:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6004:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
 6005:            fun() ->
 6006:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6007:                                  type     => stream,
 6008:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6009:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6010:            end).
 6011: 
 6012: 
 6013: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6014: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6015: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6016: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
 6017: 
 6018: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6019:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6020:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
 6021:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6022:            fun() ->
 6023:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6024:                                  type     => stream,
 6025:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6026:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6027:            end).
 6028: 
 6029: 
 6030: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6031: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6032: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6033: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
 6034: 
 6035: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6036:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6037:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
 6038:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 6039:            fun() ->
 6040:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6041:                                  type     => stream,
 6042:                                  protocol => default},
 6043:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6044:            end).
 6045: 
 6046: 
 6047: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6048: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6049: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6050: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6051: 
 6052: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6053:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6054:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
 6055:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6056:            fun() ->
 6057:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6058:                                  type     => dgram,
 6059:                                  protocol => udp},
 6060:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6061:            end).
 6062: 
 6063: 
 6064: 
 6065: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6066: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6067: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6068: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6069: 
 6070: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6071:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6072:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6,
 6073:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6074:            fun() ->
 6075:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6076:                                  type     => dgram,
 6077:                                  protocol => udp},
 6078:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6079:            end).
 6080: 
 6081: 
 6082: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6083: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6084: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6085: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
 6086: 
 6087: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6088:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6089:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
 6090:            fun() ->
 6091: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6092: 		   is_not_windows()
 6093: 	   end,
 6094:            fun() ->
 6095:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6096:                                  type     => dgram,
 6097:                                  protocol => default},
 6098:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6099:            end).
 6100: 
 6101: 
 6102: 
 6103: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6104: 
 6105: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
 6106:     OwnerSeq =
 6107:         [
 6108:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6109:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6110:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6111:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6112:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6113:                    end},
 6114:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6115:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6116:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6117:                            ok
 6118:                    end},
 6119: 
 6120:          %% *** Init part ***
 6121:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6122:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6123:                          type     := Type, 
 6124:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6125:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 6126:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6127:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6128:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6129:                                    ERROR
 6130:                            end
 6131:                    end},
 6132:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6133:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6134:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6135:                            ok
 6136:                    end},
 6137: 
 6138:          %% *** The actual test ***
 6139:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
 6140:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6141:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6142:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6143:                                ok ->
 6144:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6145:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6146:                                    ERROR
 6147:                            end
 6148:                    end},
 6149: 
 6150:          %% *** We are done ***
 6151:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6152:         ],
 6153: 
 6154:     TesterSeq =
 6155:         [
 6156:          %% *** Init part ***
 6157:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 6158:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 6159:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 6160:                            ok
 6161:                    end},
 6162:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 6163:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6164:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6165:                            ok
 6166:                    end},
 6167:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 6168:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 6169:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 6170:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6171:                    end},
 6172:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
 6173:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6174:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6175:                                {ok, Pid} ->
 6176:                                    ok;
 6177:                                {ok, Other} ->
 6178:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
 6179:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6180:                                    ERROR
 6181:                            end
 6182:                    end},
 6183:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 6184:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6185:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6186:                            ok
 6187:                    end},
 6188:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 6189:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6190:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6191:                                ok ->
 6192:                                    ok;
 6193:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6194:                                    ERROR
 6195:                            end
 6196:                    end},
 6197: 
 6198:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 6199: 
 6200:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
 6201:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
 6202:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
 6203:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
 6204:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
 6205:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
 6206:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
 6207:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6208:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6209:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
 6210:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
 6211:                                {error, closed} ->
 6212:                                    ok;
 6213:                                {error, Reason} ->
 6214:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 6215:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
 6216:                            end
 6217:                    end},
 6218: 
 6219:          %% *** We are done ***
 6220:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6221:         ],
 6222: 
 6223:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 6224:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 6225: 
 6226:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6227:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 6228:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6229: 
 6230:     i("await evaluator"),
 6231:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 6232: 
 6233: 
 6234: 
 6235: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6236: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6237: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
 6238: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6239: %% 
 6240: %% <KOLLA>
 6241: %% 
 6242: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
 6243: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
 6244: %% all the other functions.
 6245: %% 
 6246: %% </KOLLA>
 6247: 
 6248: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6249:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6250:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
 6251:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6252:            fun() ->
 6253:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6254:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6255:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6256:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6257:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6258:            end).
 6259: 
 6260: 
 6261: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6262: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6263: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6264: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6265: 
 6266: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6267:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6268:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
 6269:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6270:            fun() ->
 6271:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6272:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6273:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6274:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6275:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6276:            end).
 6277: 
 6278: 
 6279: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6280: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6281: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6282: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 6283: 
 6284: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6285:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6286:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
 6287:            fun() ->
 6288: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
 6289: 	   end,
 6290:            fun() ->
 6291:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6292:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6293:                                  protocol => default,
 6294:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6295:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6296:            end).
 6297:
