 7550: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7551: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7552: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7553: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7554: %% git the setup anyway.
 7555: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7556: 
 7557: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7558:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7559:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
 7560:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7561:            fun() ->
 7562:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7563:                                  protocol => default},
 7564:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7565:            end).
 7566: 
 7567: 
 7568: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7569: 
 7570: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7571:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
 7572:         [
 7573:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7574:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 7575:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7576:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7577:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7578:                    end},
 7579:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7580:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7581:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7582:                            ok
 7583:                    end},
 7584: 
 7585:          %% *** Init part ***
 7586:          #{desc => "which local address",
 7587:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7588:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7589:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 7590:                    end},
 7591:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 7592:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 7593:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7594:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 7595:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7596:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 7597:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7598:                                    ERROR
 7599:                            end
 7600:                    end},
 7601:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 7602:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
 7603:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7604:                                ok ->
 7605:                                    ok;
 7606:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7607:                                    ERROR
 7608:                            end
 7609:                    end},
 7610:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 7611:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 7612:                            socket:listen(Sock)
 7613:                    end},
 7614:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7615:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7616:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7617:                            ok
 7618:                    end},
 7619: 
 7620:          %% The actual test
 7621:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7622:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7623:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 7624:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7625:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7626:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7627:                                    ERROR
 7628:                            end
 7629:                    end},
 7630:          #{desc => "await connection",
 7631:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
 7632:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
 7633:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7634:                                    ok;
 7635:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7636:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
 7637:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7638:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7639:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7640:                                    ERROR
 7641:                            end
 7642:                    end},
 7643:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
 7644:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7645:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
 7646:                            ok
 7647:                    end},
 7648:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7649:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7650:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7651:                    end},
 7652:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7653:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7654:                          sock   := Sock,
 7655:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7656:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7657:                                ok ->
 7658:                                    State1 =
 7659:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 7660:                                                    fun() ->
 7661:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 7662:                                                    end,
 7663:                                                    fun() ->
 7664:                                                            State
 7665:                                                    end),
 7666:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7667:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7668:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 7669:                                    ERROR
 7670:                            end;
 7671:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7672:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7673:                                ok ->
 7674:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7675:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7676:                                    ERROR
 7677:                            end
 7678:                    end},
 7679:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7680:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7681:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7682:                            ok
 7683:                    end},
 7684: 
 7685:                                                 % Termination
 7686:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 7687:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7688:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7689:                                ok ->
 7690:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7691:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7692:                                    ERROR
 7693:                            end
 7694:                    end},
 7695: 
 7696:          %% *** We are done ***
 7697:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7698:         ],
 7699: 
 7700:     SecAcceptorSeq =
 7701:         [
 7702:          %% *** Init part ***
 7703:          #{desc => "await start",
 7704:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7705:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7706:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7707:                    end},
 7708:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7709:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7710:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7711:                            ok
 7712:                    end},
 7713:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7714:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7715:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
 7716:                    end},
 7717: 
 7718:          %% The actual test
 7719:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7720:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7721:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 7722:                    end},
 7723:          #{desc => "accept",
 7724:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7725:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
 7726:                                {error, closed} ->
 7727:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7728:                                {ok, _} ->
 7729:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7730:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7731:                                    ERROR
 7732:                            end
 7733:                    end},
 7734:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
 7735:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7736:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
 7737:                    end},
 7738: 
 7739:          %% Termination
 7740:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7741:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7742:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7743:                                ok ->
 7744:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7745:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7746:                                    ERROR
 7747:                            end
 7748:                    end},
 7749: 
 7750:          %% *** We are done ***
 7751:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7752:         ],
 7753: 
 7754:     TesterSeq =
 7755:         [
 7756:          %% *** Init part ***
 7757:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
 7758:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7759:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7760:                            ok
 7761:                    end},
 7762:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
 7763:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7764:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7765:                            ok
 7766:                    end},
 7767:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
 7768:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7769:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7770:                            ok
 7771:                    end},
 7772:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
 7773:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7774:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7775:                            ok
 7776:                    end},
 7777: 
 7778:          %% Start the primary server
 7779:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
 7780:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7781:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7782:                            ok
 7783:                    end},
 7784:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
 7785:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7786:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
 7787:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7788:                    end},
 7789: 
 7790:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
 7791:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
 7792:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7793:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7794:                            ok
 7795:                    end},
 7796:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
 7797:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7798:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
 7799:                    end},
 7800: 
 7801:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
 7802:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
 7803:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7804:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7805:                            ok
 7806:                    end},
 7807:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
 7808:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7809:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
 7810:                    end},
 7811: 
 7812:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
 7813:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
 7814:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7815:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7816:                            ok
 7817:                    end},
 7818:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
 7819:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7820:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
 7821:                    end},
 7822: 
 7823: 
 7824:          %% The actual test
 7825:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7826:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7827:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7828:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7829:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7830: 
 7831:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
 7832:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7833:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7834:                            ok
 7835:                    end},
 7836:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7837:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
 7838:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7839:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7840:                            ok
 7841:                    end},
 7842:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7843:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
 7844:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7845:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7846:                            ok
 7847:                    end},
 7848:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7849:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
 7850:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7851:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
 7852:                            ok
 7853:                    end},
 7854:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
 7855:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7856:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
 7857:                    end},
 7858:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
 7859:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7860:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7861:                            ok
 7862:                    end},
 7863:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
 7864:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7865:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
 7866:                    end},
 7867:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
 7868:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7869:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
 7870:                    end},
 7871:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
 7872:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7873:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
 7874:                    end},
 7875:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
 7876:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7877:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
 7878:                    end},
 7879: 
 7880: 
 7881:          %% Terminations
 7882:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
 7883:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7884:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7885:                            ok
 7886:                    end},
 7887:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
 7888:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7889:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7890:                                ok ->
 7891:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
 7892:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7893:                                    ERROR
 7894:                            end
 7895:                    end},
 7896:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
 7897:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7898:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7899:                            ok
 7900:                    end},
 7901:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
 7902:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7903:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7904:                                ok ->
 7905:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
 7906:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7907:                                    ERROR
 7908:                            end
 7909:                    end},
 7910:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
 7911:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7912:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7913:                            ok
 7914:                    end},
 7915:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
 7916:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7917:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7918:                                ok ->
 7919:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
 7920:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7921:                                    ERROR
 7922:                            end
 7923:                    end},
 7924:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
 7925:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7926:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7927:                            ok
 7928:                    end},
 7929:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
 7930:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7931:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7932:                                ok ->
 7933:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
 7934:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7935:                                    ERROR
 7936:                            end
 7937:                    end},
 7938: 
 7939: 
 7940:          %% *** We are done ***
 7941:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7942:         ],
 7943: 
 7944: 
 7945:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
 7946:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
 7947:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
 7948: 
 7949:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
 7950:     SecAccInitState = #{},
 7951:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7952: 
 7953:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
 7954:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7955: 
 7956:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
 7957:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7958: 
 7959:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7960:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
 7961:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
 7962:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
 7963:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
 7964:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7965: 
 7966:     i("await evaluator"),
 7967:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
 7968: 
 7969: 
 7970: 
 7971: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7972: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7973: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7974: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7975: %%
 7976: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 7977: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 7978: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 7979: %%
 7980: 
 7981: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7982:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7983:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7984:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7985:            fun() ->
 7986:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7987:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7988:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7989:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7990:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7991:            end).
 7992: 
 7993: 
 7994: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7995: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7996: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7997: %% Socket is IPv6.
 7998: 
 7999: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8000:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8001:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8002:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 8003:            fun() ->
 8004:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8005:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 8006:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8007:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8008:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8009:            end).
 8010: 
 8011: 
 8012: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8013: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8014: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 8015: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 8016: 
 8017: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8018:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8019:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8020:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 8021:            fun() ->
 8022:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8023:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 8024:                                  protocol => default,
 8025:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8026:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8027:            end).
 8028: 
 8029: 
 8030: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8031: 
 8032: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 8033:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
 8034:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
 8035:     %% by the server!
 8036:     ServerSeq =
 8037:         [
 8038:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8039:          #{desc => "await start",
 8040:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8041:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8042:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 8043:                    end},
 8044:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8045:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8046:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8047:                            ok
 8048:                    end},
 8049: 
 8050:          %% *** Init part ***
 8051:          #{desc => "which local address",
 8052:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 8053:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8054:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 8055:                    end},
 8056:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 8057:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 8058:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8059:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8060:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 8061:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8062:                                    ERROR
 8063:                            end
 8064:                    end},
 8065:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 8066:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8067:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8068:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 8069:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8070:                                ok ->
 8071:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 8072:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8073:                                    ERROR
 8074:                            end;
 8075:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 8076:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 8077:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8078:                                ok ->
 8079:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 8080:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 8081:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8082:                                    ERROR
 8083:                            end
 8084:                    end},
 8085:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 8086:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8087:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 8088:                    end},
 8089:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8090:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 8091:                          tester   := Tester,
 8092:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 8093:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
 8094:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
 8095:                            %% as for non-local.
 8096:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 8097:                            ok;
 8098:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 8099:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 8100:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 8101:                            ok
 8102:                    end},
 8103: 
 8104:          %% The actual test
 8105:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
 8106:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8107:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 8108:                    end},
 8109:          #{desc => "accept 1",
 8110:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8111:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8112:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8113:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8114:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
 8115:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8116:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
 8117:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
 8118:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8119:                                    ERROR
 8120:                            end
 8121:                    end},
 8122:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 8123:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8124:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
 8125:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
 8126:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8127:                    end},
 8128:          #{desc => "accept 2",
 8129:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8130:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8131:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8132:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8133:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
 8134:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8135:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
 8136:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
 8137:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8138:                                    ERROR
 8139:                            end
 8140:                    end},
 8141:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 8142:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8143:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8144:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
 8145:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
 8146:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8147:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
 8148:                    end},
 8149:          #{desc => "accept 3",
 8150:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8151:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8152:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8153:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8154:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
 8155:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8156:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
 8157:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
 8158:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8159:                                    ERROR
 8160:                            end
 8161:                    end},
 8162:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 8163:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8164:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8165:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
 8166:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
 8167:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
 8168:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8169:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
 8170:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
 8171:                    end},
 8172:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
 8173:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8174:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 8175:                            ok
 8176:                    end},
 8177: 
 8178: 
 8179:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 8180:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8181:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 8182:                    end},
 8183:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
 8184:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8185:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8186:                            ok
 8187:                    end},
 8188:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
 8189:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8190:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8191:                            ok
 8192:                    end},
 8193:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
 8194:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8195:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8196:                            ok
 8197:                    end},
 8198:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
 8199:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8200:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8201:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8202:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8203:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
 8204:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8205:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
 8206:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8207:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8208:                                    Result;
 8209:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8210:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
 8211:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8212:                                    ERROR
 8213:                            end
 8214:                    end},
 8215:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
 8216:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8217:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8218:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8219:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8220:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
 8221:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8222:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8223:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8224:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8225:                                    Result;
 8226:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8227:                                    ERROR
 8228:                            end
 8229:                    end},
 8230:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
 8231:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8232:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8233:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8234:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8235:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
 8236:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8237:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8238:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
 8239:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8240:                                    Result;
 8241:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8242:                                    ERROR
 8243:                            end
 8244:                    end},
 8245:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
 8246:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8247:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 8248:                            ok
 8249:                    end},
 8250: 
 8251:          %% Termination
 8252:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8253:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 8254:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 8255:                                ok ->
 8256:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8257:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8258:                                    ERROR
 8259:                            end
 8260:                    end},
 8261:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 8262:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8263:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
 8264:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8265:                            ok
 8266:                    end},
 8267:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 8268:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8269:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8270:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
 8271:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
 8272:                            {ok, State2}
 8273:                    end},
 8274:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 8275:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8276:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8277:                            ok
 8278:                    end},
 8279:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 8280:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8281:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8282:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
 8283:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
 8284:                            {ok, State2}
 8285:                    end},
 8286:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 8287:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8288:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8289:                            ok
 8290:                    end},
 8291:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 8292:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8293:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8294:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
 8295:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
 8296:                            {ok, State2}
 8297:                    end},
 8298:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 8299:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8300:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8301:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 8302:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8303:                                ok ->
 8304:                                    State1 =
 8305:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 8306:                                                    fun() ->
 8307:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 8308:                                                    end,
 8309:                                                    fun() ->
 8310:                                                            State
 8311:                                                    end),
 8312:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 8313:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8314:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 8315:                                    ERROR
 8316:                            end;
 8317:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 8318:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8319:                                ok ->
 8320:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 8321:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8322:                                    ERROR
 8323:                            end
 8324:                    end},
 8325: 
 8326:          %% *** We are done ***
 8327:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8328:         ],
 8329: 
 8330:     ClientSeq =
 8331:         [
 8332:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8333:          #{desc => "await start",
 8334:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8335:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8336:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 8337:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
 8338:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8339:                    end},
 8340:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8341:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8342:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8343:                            ok
 8344:                    end},
 8345: 
 8346:          %% *** Init part ***
 8347:          #{desc => "create node",
 8348:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
 8349:                            {Peer, Node} =
 8350:                                start_node(?CT_PEER_NAME(?F("client_~w",
 8351:                                                            [NodeID]))),
 8352:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
 8353:                    end},
 8354:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
 8355:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 8356:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 8357:                            ok
 8358:                    end},
 8359:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 8360:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 8361:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
 8362:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 8363:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 8364:                    end},
 8365:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 8366:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 8367:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8368:                            ok
 8369:                    end},
 8370:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 8371:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 8372:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 8373:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
 8374:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 8375:                            ok
 8376:                    end},
 8377:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 8378:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8379:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8380:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 8381:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8382:                    end},
 8383:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8384:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8385:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 8386:                            ok
 8387:                    end},
 8388: 
 8389:          %% The actual test
 8390:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 8391:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8392:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8393:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 8394:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8395:                            ok
 8396:                    end},
 8397:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 8398:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8399:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 8400:                            ok
 8401:                    end},
 8402:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 8403:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8404:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8405:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
 8406:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8407:                    end},
 8408:          #{desc => "announce ready (connected)",
 8409:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8410:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 8411:                            ok
 8412:                    end},
 8413:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 8414:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8415:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8416:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
 8417:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8418:                            ok
 8419:                    end},
 8420:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
 8421:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8422:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 8423:                            ok
 8424:                    end},
 8425:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 8426:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8427:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8428:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close, 
 8429:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8430:                    end},
 8431:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 8432:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8433:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 8434:                            ok
 8435:                    end},
 8436: 
 8437:          %% Termination
 8438:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8439:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 8440:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 8441:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 8442:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 8443:                                ok ->
 8444:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8445:                                {error,
 8446:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
 8447:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
 8448:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
 8449:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
 8450:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
 8451:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8452:                                    ERROR
 8453:                            end
 8454:                    end},
 8455:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 8456:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
 8457:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
 8458:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
 8459:                            ok
 8460:                    end},
 8461:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 8462:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 8463:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 8464:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
 8465:                                        [RClient]),
 8466:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 8467:                            {ok, State1}
 8468:                    end},
 8469:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 8470:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 8471:                            {ok,
 8472:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 8473:                                 ok ->
 8474:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 8475:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 8476:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8477:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8478:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8479:                             catch
 8480:                                 C:E:S ->
 8481:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8482:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 8483:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 8484:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 8485:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8486:                             end}
 8487:                    end},
 8488:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 8489:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 8490:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
 8491:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
 8492:                            receive
 8493:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 8494:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 8495:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8496:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8497:                                    {ok, State2}
 8498:                            end;
 8499:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 8500:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 8501:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8502:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8503:                            {ok, State2}
 8504:                    end},
 8505: 
 8506:          %% *** We are done ***
 8507:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8508:         ],

 8730:                    end},

 8758:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8759:                            ok
 8760:                    end},
 8761:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 8762:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8763:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8764:                                ok ->
 8765:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 8766:                                    {ok, State1};
 8767:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8768:                                    ERROR
 8769:                            end
 8770:                    end},
 8771: 
 8772:          %% *** We are done ***
 8773:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8774:         ],
 8775: 
 8776:     i("start server evaluator"),
 8777:     ServerInitState = InitState,
 8778:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 8779: 
 8780:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 8781:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 8782:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8783:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8784:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8785: 
 8786:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 8787:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
 8788:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 8789:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 8790:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
 8791:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 8792: 
 8793:     i("await evaluator"),
 8794:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
 8795:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
 8796:                             Tester]).
 8797: 
 8798: 
 8799: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
 8800:     Self = self(),
 8801:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
 8802:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 8803: 
 8804: 
 8805: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
 8806:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 8807:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 8808:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 8809:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 8810:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 8811:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 8812:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 8813:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 8814:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 8815:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 8816:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 8817:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 8818:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 8819:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 8820:     exit(Reason).
 8821: 
 8822: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 8823:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 8824:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 8825:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8826:     ok.
 8827: 
 8828: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 8829:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 8830:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 8831: 
 8832: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 8833:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 8834:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8835:         {ok, Sock} ->
 8836:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
 8837:                 {ok, FD} ->
 8838:                     put(sname, ?F("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
 8839:                 _ ->
 8840:                     ok
 8841:             end,
 8842:             Sock;
 8843:         {error, Reason} ->
 8844:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 8845:     end.
 8846: 
 8847: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 8848:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 8849:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8850:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 8851:         ok ->
 8852:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 8853:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 8854:                     Path;
 8855:                 {ok, _} ->
 8856:                     undefined;
 8857:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 8858:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 8859:             end;
 8860:         {error, Reason} ->
 8861:             exit({bind, Reason})
 8862:     end.
 8863: 
 8864: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8865:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
 8866:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 8867: 
 8868: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8869:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
 8870:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8871: 
 8872: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 8873:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 8874:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 8875:         ok ->
 8876:             ok;
 8877:         {error, Reason} ->
 8878:             exit({connect, Reason})
 8879:     end.
 8880: 
 8881: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 8882:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 8883:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 8884:         ok ->
 8885:             unlink_path(Path),
 8886:             ok;
 8887:         {error, Reason} ->
 8888:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 8889:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 8890:             unlink_path(Path),
 8891:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 8892:     end.
 8893: 
 8894: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 8895:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 8896:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 8897:         ok ->
 8898:             ok;
 8899:         {error, Reason} ->
 8900:             Reason
 8901:     end.
 8902: 
 8903: 
 8904: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 8905: 
 8906: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
 8907:     Self     = self(),
 8908:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 8909:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 8910:     Pid.
 8911: 
 8912: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 8913:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
 8914:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 8915:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
 8916:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
 8917:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 8918:     exit(Reason).
 8919: 
 8920: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
 8921:     put(sname, ?F("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
 8922:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8923:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 8924:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 8925:     ok.
 8926: 
 8927: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 8928:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 8929:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 8930: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8931:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 8932:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8933: 
 8934: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
 8935:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 8936:     try Recv(Sock) of
 8937:         {error, closed} ->
 8938:             ok;
 8939:         {ok, Data} ->
 8940:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
 8941:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
 8942:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
 8943:             {error, unexpected_success};
 8944:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8945:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 8946:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8947:             ERROR
 8948:     catch
 8949:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
 8950:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
 8951:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
 8952:             exit({skip, Error});
 8953:         C:E:S ->
 8954:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 8955:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 8956:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 8957:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 8958:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 8959:     end.
 8960: 
 8961: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 8962:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 8963:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 8964:     ok.
 8965: 
 8966: 
 8967: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8968: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8969: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8970: %% Socket is IPv4.
 8971: 
 8972: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8973:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8974:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
 8975:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 8976:            fun() ->
 8977:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8978:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 8979:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8980:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8981:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8982:            end).
 8983:

 9005: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.

 9012:            fun() ->
 9013:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
